context.p: To configure a connection to a database, follow these steps:The bootstrap type of X-Hive/DB connections is not supported in . The following procedure explains the xhive:// protocol connection type.

step.cmd: Select a previously configured data source from the Data Source drop-down menu.

substep.cmd: Set the URL property of the connection in the URL field.
substep.info: If the property is a URL of the form xhive://host:port, the connection will attempt to connect to a server running behind the specified TCP/IP port.

substep.cmd: Set the user name to access the engine in the User field.
Set the password to access the engine in the Password field.
Set the name of the database to access from the engine in the Database field.
Select the Run XQuery in read / write session (with committing) checkbox if you want to end the session with a commit. Otherwise, the session ends with a rollback.

step.cmd: To view your connection, go to the Data Source Explorer view or switch to the Database perspective.
